content.title: Right Aortic Arch
content.description: Aortic arch passing to right of trachea

key_concepts.details: With mirror-image branching (often with CHD) vs. aberrant left subclavian (usually isolated)
Right arch with aberrant left subclavian and left ligamentum forms complete vascular ring
Tetralogy of Fallot, truncus arteriosus, pulmonary atresia with VSD
Symptomatic ring requires division of ligamentum arteriosum

content.clinical_significance: Right arch with aberrant left subclavian may cause dysphagia

primary_sources: Backer CL et al. Semin Thorac Cardiovasc Surg 2012
